intro: Hoya devogelii, commonly known as the velvet hoya, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that give it a velvety appearance, and it produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is often grown as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements. Hoya devogelii thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its unique appearance and ease of care make it a popular choice among plant enthusiasts.
